intro: Laseguea pubiflora, commonly known as the hairy-flowered laseguea, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apocynaceae. It is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. The plant produces clusters of small, showy flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It is native to certain regions of South America, particularly in countries like Brazil and Peru. Laseguea pubiflora is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and shrublands.
